name: E. Klee s SUPER DUPER LARGE Array
statement:
Klee has an array a of length n containing integers [k, k+1, ..., k+n-1]
in that order. Klee wants to choose an index i (1
leq i
leq n) such that x = |a_1 + a_2 +
dots + a_i - a_{i+1} -
dots - a_n| is minimized. Note that for an arbitrary integer z, |z|
represents the absolute value of z. Output the minimum possible value of
x.
